div.p: type is specified as either html or xhtml, but the content is not valid HTML.

ul.li: Arbitrary truncation of HTML, possibly in the middle of a tag.
Unmatched quotes in attribute values, or missing whitespace between attributes
Declaring the type as html, but not properly escaping the character data. Example: representing a less than sign ("<") in escaped HTML requires the following code: &lt;
